{"id":1296886821,"question_id":3477,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"7 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1719073811,"status":14,"status_display":"Time Limit Exceeded","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1296886821/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Operations to Make Binary Array Elements Equal to One II","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    //vector<int> ans;\n    int minOperations(vector<int>& nums) {\n        int sz = nums.size();\n        //minimum number of operations required to make all elements in nums equal to 1\n        //any index i from the array and flip all the elements from index i to the end of the array.\n        //ans.resize(sz);\n        return helper(nums, 0);\n   \n        \n    }\n    \n    int helper(vector<int>& nums, int start) {\n        int sz = nums.size();\n        if(start == sz-1) {\n            if(nums[start]==1)\n                return 0;\n            else\n                return 1;\n        }\n\n        for(; start<sz; start++) {\n            if(nums[start] == 1 )\n                continue;\n            else {                \n                for(int j=start+1; j<sz; j++) {\n                    nums[j] = 1- nums[j];\n                }                \n                return  1+helper(nums, start+1);\n            }     \n        }     \n        return 0;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-operations-to-make-binary-array-elements-equal-to-one-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
